availability.p: All research and writing of Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition annotations was undertaken by project staff, volunteers, and interns. Each record contains citations to relevant primary and secondary source material. All annotations are copyright Kentucky Historical Society, and should be referenced as such in any published work.

seriesStmt.title: Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition

person.persName: Benjamin Daniel Lacy (Owingsville, Kentucky, attorney & county atty)

body.p: Owingsville, Kentucky, attorney. Kentucky native. Married to Ann Trumbo Lacy in Shelby County, Kentucky, in June 1851. Father of Mary W. Lacy. Married to Mary Louisa Jewett Lacy in Montgomery County, Kentucky, on February 19, 1861. Father of J. Jewett Lacy and Elizabeth O. Lacy. Attended Harvard Law School in Cambridge, Massachusetts, from 1841 to 1842. Attorney in Bath County, Kentucky, in 1850. Attorney in Owingsville in 1860. Owned four enslaved persons in Owingsville in 1860. Attorney in Owingsville in 1865.

ab.bibl:

Ninth Manuscript Census of the United States (1870), Population Schedules, Kentucky, Bath County, Owingsville Precinct, p. 59A.

Kentucky Birth, Marriage and Death Records – Microfilm (1852-1910), KDLA, Roll #994027-58, Montgomery County Marriages, p. 9 of 24 on microfilm (accessed via Ancestry.com).
Quinquennial Catalogue of the Officers and Students of the Law School of Harvard University, 1817 – 1889 (Cambridge, Mass: Law School, 1890), 22, 60.
